description: Returns information about an ML input channel.

parameters.name: mlInputChannelArn
parameters.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the ML input channel that you want to get.

parameters.name: membershipIdentifier
parameters.description: The membership ID of the membership that contains the ML input channel that you want to get.

nested_items.name: createTime
nested_items.description: The time at which the ML input channel was created.

nested_items.name: updateTime
nested_items.description: The most recent time at which the ML input channel was updated.

nested_items.name: membershipIdentifier
nested_items.description: The membership ID of the membership that contains the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: collaborationIdentifier
nested_items.description: The collaboration ID of the collaboration that contains the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: inputChannel
nested_items.description: The input channel that was used to create the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: dataSource
nested_items.description: The data source that is used to create the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: protectedQueryInputParameters
nested_items.description: Provides information necessary to perform the protected query.

nested_items.name: sqlParameters
nested_items.description: The parameters for the SQL type Protected Query.

nested_items.name: queryString
nested_items.description: The query string to be submitted.

nested_items.name: analysisTemplateArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) associated with the analysis template within a collaboration.

nested_items.name: parameters
nested_items.description: The protected query SQL parameters.
(string) ---
(string) ---

nested_items.name: computeConfiguration
nested_items.description: Provides configuration information for the workers that will perform the protected query.

nested_items.name: type
nested_items.description: The instance type of the compute workers that are used.

nested_items.name: number
nested_items.description: The number of compute workers that are used.

nested_items.name: roleArn
nested_items.description: The ARN of the IAM role that Clean Rooms ML can assume to read the data referred to in the dataSource field the input channel.

nested_items.name: protectedQueryIdentifier
nested_items.description: The ID of the protected query that was used to create the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: mlInputChannelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: name
nested_items.description: The name of the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: configuredModelAlgorithmAssociations
nested_items.description: The configured model algorithm associations that were used to create the ML input channel.
(string) ---

nested_items.name: status
nested_items.description: The status of the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: statusDetails
nested_items.description: Details about the status of a resource.

nested_items.name: statusCode
nested_items.description: The status code that was returned. The status code is intended for programmatic error handling. Clean Rooms ML will not change the status code for existing error conditions.

nested_items.name: message
nested_items.description: The error message that was returned. The message is intended for human consumption and can change at any time. Use the statusCode for programmatic error handling.

nested_items.name: retentionInDays
nested_items.description: The number of days to keep the data in the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: numberOfRecords
nested_items.description: The number of records in the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: numberOfFiles
nested_items.description: The number of files in the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: sizeInGb
nested_items.description: The size, in GB, of the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: description
nested_items.description: The description of the ML input channel.

nested_items.name: kmsKeyArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name (ARN) of the KMS key that was used to create the ML input channel.
Maximum number of tags per resource - 50.
For each resource, each tag key must be unique, and each tag key can have only one value.
Maximum key length - 128 Unicode characters in UTF-8.
Maximum value length - 256 Unicode characters in UTF-8.

If your tagging schema is used across multiple services and resources, remember that other services may have restrictions on allowed characters. Generally allowed characters are: letters, numbers, and spaces representable in UTF-8, and the following characters: + - = . _ : / @.
Tag keys and values are case sensitive.

Do not use aws:, AWS:, or any upper or lowercase combination of such as a prefix for keys as it is reserved for AWS use. You cannot edit or delete tag keys with this prefix. Values can have this prefix. If a tag value has aws as its prefix but the key does not, then Clean Rooms ML considers it to be a user tag and will count against the limit of 50 tags. Tags with only the key prefix of aws do not count against your tags per resource limit.
